articles.title: Schwab Trading Activity Index™: December Score Edges Higher for Third Consecutive Month
articles.summary: The Schwab Trading Activity Index™ (STAX) increased to 51.16 in December, marking its third consecutive monthly rise. Schwab clients net bought equities, adding exposure in Health Care and Energy sectors, while selling Information Technology and Communication Services. The report highlights market volatility, key economic data releases, and popular stocks bought and sold by Schwab clients throughout December and the entirety of 2024.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs says to buy the dip in AI
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs's trading desk suggests buying the dip in AI-related stocks, despite recent declines, due to anticipated lower interest rates and strong fundamentals. The bank expects significant net income growth for AI companies and increased power generation tied to the technology, identifying a buying opportunity amidst what it perceives as excessive AI pessimism.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs top strategist: We’re on the precipice of a summer correction
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs's tactical strategist Scott Rubner warns of an impending summer correction for the S&P 500, citing historical data indicating a downturn typically begins around July 17th, followed by weak August outflows. He believes the "pain trade is no longer higher" as good news is already priced in, and systematic funds have reached maximum length. Rubner recommends put options on the Nasdaq 100 and S&P 500 to clients.

articles.title: Surgical Trades on the Magnificent 7
articles.summary: This article discusses Direxion's leveraged and inverse ETFs designed for trading the Magnificent 7 stocks, either individually or as a collective basket. It highlights how these products allow traders to seek profit or hedge risk based on market direction and news, while also outlining the significant risks associated with single stock and leveraged ETFs, emphasizing they are for sophisticated and aggressive investors.

articles.title: Li Lu – Top 10 Holdings – Latest 13F
articles.summary: This article details the top 10 holdings of superinvestor Li Lu's portfolio as of June 30, 2024, based on his latest 13F-HR filing. His portfolio has a market value of over $2.5 billion, with significant concentrations in companies like Bank of America, Alphabet, Berkshire Hathaway, and Apple. The article emphasizes using 13F-HR documents to track superinvestors' strategies.

articles.title: Apple supplier Jabil benches its CEO as it investigates his conduct—but he’ll still collect his full $1 million salary
articles.summary: Jabil, a key Apple supplier and technology manufacturer, has benched its CEO, Kenny Wilson, due to an investigation into his conduct, though he will continue to receive his full $1 million salary. The company's CFO, Michael Dastoor, has been appointed interim CEO as the probe, which is unrelated to financial statements, unfolds. This comes less than a year after Wilson took the helm, following a long career within the company.

articles.title: News Corp Initiates US$1 Billion Stock Buy-Back
articles.summary: News Corporation has announced a new repurchase program to buy back up to US$1 billion of its Class A and Class B common stock. This buy-back will be conducted sporadically in the open market or through other methods, excluding ASX-listed CDIs. The program is conditional on market factors and the stock's trading price, with 161,397,541 securities on issue in the class to be bought back.

articles.title: Cirrus Logic Celebrates 40 Years of Innovation and Excellence
articles.summary: Cirrus Logic, a leader in mixed-signal processing, is celebrating its 40th anniversary, reflecting on its journey from a startup to a global technology innovator. The company has a rich history of developing groundbreaking solutions for audio and electronics industries, holding over 3,900 patents, and has grown through strategic refocuses and acquisitions like Wolfson Microelectronics. CEO John Forsyth and VP Carl Alberty emphasize the company's commitment to innovation, customer trust, and its award-winning culture that fosters employee loyalty and professional growth.

articles.title: When does Amazon Prime Day 2024 end? How to score last minute deals before it's too late
articles.summary: Amazon Prime Day 2024 is concluding in the early hours of Wednesday and Thursday, depending on the time zone, giving shoppers a final chance to snag deals on various products. The two-day event, which started Tuesday, features discounts on Amazon services and devices, as well as popular items like Apple AirPods, iRobot Roomba, and Renpho Eye Massagers. The sales are exclusive to Prime members, though non-members can sign up for a free 30-day trial to participate.

articles.title: Amazon’s AI spending plans keep stock from joining tech rebound
articles.summary: Amazon's shares are lagging behind its megacap peers due to its substantial spending on artificial intelligence computing, which is impacting its profits. Investors are concerned that increased capital spending will negatively affect cash flows, especially as the company has historically performed better when focused on profitability. This shift to investment mode, coupled with Amazon's lack of a dividend and less aggressive share buyback program compared to competitors, is causing investors to pause on the stock.

articles.title: DOJ's Visa antitrust lawsuit alleges debit card company monopoly
articles.summary: The Justice Department has filed an antitrust lawsuit against Visa, accusing the company of running a debit card monopoly that imposed billions of dollars in additional fees on American consumers and businesses. The lawsuit claims Visa stifles competition and charges excessive fees by controlling over 60% of U.S. debit transactions. Visa denies the allegations, stating its network offers security and value.

articles.title: Tandem Diabetes Care Launches Tandem Mobi, the World’s Smallest, Durable Automated Insulin Delivery System
articles.summary: Tandem Diabetes Care, Inc. (NASDAQ: TNDM) has announced the commercial launch of its new Tandem Mobi, the world's smallest durable automated insulin delivery system, now shipping to eligible customers in the United States. This system integrates the Control-IQ advanced hybrid closed-loop technology, offering improved diabetes management and flexibility through its compact design, various wearability options, and compatibility with the Dexcom G6 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System, with future integrations planned.

articles.title: Nvidia, AMD Lead The Pack, Broadcom Stable, Intel Falters: Analyst's Latest Take
articles.summary: KeyBanc analyst John Vinh provided a mixed outlook for the semiconductor sector, with Nvidia and AMD showing strong performance and positive catalysts. Conversely, Qualcomm and Synaptics were downgraded due to increased competition and limited growth, while Intel, Micron, Marvell, and Monolithic Power Systems faced negative findings. Broadcom's stable outlook is tempered by potential future competition from Apple.

articles.title: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway is buying up shares of a lagging 1990s dotcom darling
articles.summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has invested $74 million in VeriSign, despite the infrastructure company's stock falling 2% during a strong year for tech. Berkshire increased its stake by buying approximately 377,736 shares, making it VeriSign's largest shareholder with over 13 million shares worth about $2.6 billion. The investment is notable given VeriSign's high profit and operating margins and comes as Berkshire has been accumulating cash and selling off other stock holdings.

articles.title: Nvidia dethroned as world's most valuable company after just a few days on top
articles.summary: Nvidia's reign as the world's most valuable company was short-lived, with a two-day selloff erasing over $220 billion from its market capitalization and pushing it to third place behind Apple and Microsoft. Despite a 6.7% drop, analysts see no fundamental issues and expect any volatility to be temporary, reiterating "buy" ratings and raising price targets due to confidence in its AI leadership. The decline also coincided with broader market turbulence from a "triple-witching" options expiration.

articles.title: When $2B facility opens, Amkor will become Peoria's largest private employer
articles.summary: Amkor Technology Inc.'s planned $2 billion semiconductor packaging and testing plant in Peoria, recently greenlit by the City Council, is poised to become the city's largest private employer. This mega-project will bring 2,000 new jobs to the Phoenix metro area and significantly bolster the U.S. semiconductor supply chain, with the facility packaging and testing chips for major companies like TSMC and Apple. Amkor, a leading provider in outsourced semiconductor services, had $6.5 billion in annual sales in 2023 and employs 30,000 worldwide.

articles.title: Corsair Gaming Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Financial Results
articles.summary: Corsair Gaming announced its financial results for Q4 and full year 2024, reporting solid Q4 revenue and adjusted EBITDA driven by strong growth in the Gamer and Creator Peripherals segment. The company provided its 2025 outlook, anticipating revenue between $1.4 billion and $1.6 billion and adjusted EBITDA of $80 million to $100 million, expecting growth due to new high-performance GPU cards and strategic acquisitions like Fanatec.

articles.title: Apple class action allege App Store offers malicious crypto apps
articles.summary: A class action lawsuit has been filed against Apple Inc., claiming the company authorized and maintained malicious crypto applications on its App Store, leading to the theft of consumers' personal financial assets. Plaintiffs allege Apple misrepresented the safety and legality of these apps, including Digicoins, SolLuna, and Forex5, which they assert were "spoofing" programs designed to steal account information. The lawsuit seeks to represent a nationwide class of consumers for alleged violations of California's Consumers Legal Remedies Act and Unfair Competition Law.

articles.title: Apple, Google And Meta Can't Escape Gambling Lawsuits, Judge Rejects Section 230 Shield In Landmark Ruling On Casino-Style Apps
articles.summary: A federal judge has ruled that Apple, Google, and Meta must face lawsuits alleging they profited from illegal casino-style apps, rejecting their Section 230 defense. The companies are accused of hosting and promoting addictive gambling apps and taking 30% commissions on in-app purchases, with plaintiffs seeking compensatory damages for alleged addiction and its consequences. This ruling adds to the growing legal scrutiny faced by tech giants.

articles.title: Most of the ‘Sweet 16’ stocks have dominated. They might do it again in 2025.
articles.summary: The article discusses the "Sweet 16" list of stocks, initially identified by Jefferies in September 2020, highlighting their significant contribution to the U.S. stock market's performance. It suggests that these stocks, including giants like Nvidia, are poised for continued revenue growth in 2025. The piece also mentions other groups of dominant stocks, such as "BATMMAAN," which includes Broadcom and the "Magnificent Seven."

articles.title: Most of the ‘Sweet 16’ stocks have dominated. They might do it again in 2025.
articles.summary: The article discusses the "Sweet 16" stocks identified by Jefferies in September 2020, highlighting their significant contribution to the US stock market's performance over the past five years. It suggests these stocks, including Nvidia, may continue their dominant trend into 2025 due to expected revenue growth. The piece also mentions other dominant stock groupings like "BATMMAAN" and the "Magnificent Seven."

articles.title: Inflation is causing pet parents to pull back on treats, says J.M. Smucker’s CFO
articles.summary: J.M. Smucker's CFO, Tucker Marshall, notes that inflation is causing pet owners to reduce treat purchases and overall snacking, impacting the company's outlook despite strong growth in products like Uncrustables. The company achieved a 10% increase in quarterly profit per share, beating estimates, but faces challenges from rising coffee prices and reduced discretionary spending, leading to a revised lower sales forecast for the year.

articles.title: Apple Intelligence
articles.summary: Apple Intelligence integrates generative AI into iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Apple Vision Pro, focusing on enhancing communication, image creation, and productivity. Key features include Writing Tools for text refinement, Live Translation, Image Playground for generating images and Genmoji, and an enhanced Siri with on-screen awareness and device knowledge, all while prioritizing user privacy through on-device processing and Private Cloud Compute. The system also seamlessly integrates ChatGPT for broader expertise.

articles.title: Apple Watch For Your Kids
articles.summary: This article highlights the features and benefits of Apple Watch for kids, emphasizing how parents can manage their children's watches using their own iPhone. Key functionalities include communication, location tracking, Schooltime mode, health and activity features, emergency SOS, and access to Apple Music and the App Store. The Apple Watch is presented as a tool for independence for children and peace of mind for parents.

articles.title: Buy Apple Vision Pro
articles.summary: This page is a product listing for the Apple Vision Pro, detailing available purchasing options and extensive terms and conditions for financing through Apple Card Monthly Installments (ACMI) and AppleCare plans. It outlines eligibility, APR details, and coverage specifics for various Apple services and products related to the Vision Pro.

articles.title: Amazon’s Prime Big Deal Days was the Company’s Biggest October Shopping Event Ever
articles.summary: Amazon's Prime Big Deal Days was its biggest October shopping event ever, with more Prime members participating and saving over $1 billion globally on various products. The event marked a strong start to the holiday shopping season, featuring innovative shopping tools like Rufus and Inspire, and Amazon plans further deals through the end of the year, including specific holiday events and the NFL Black Friday Football game.

articles.title: Ford most at risk from China exposure among 250 American companies, consulting firm says
articles.summary: A consulting firm, Strategy Risks, has identified Ford Motor Co. as the American company most exposed to risks from China among 250 of the largest listed U.S. companies. Ford scored 69 out of 100 on their exposure index, surpassing Apple and Tesla, due to factors like revenue in China, partnerships, and supply chain risks. Ford declined to comment on the rankings, citing a lack of detailed methodology.

articles.title: How Corning is ushering in the AI revolution
articles.summary: Corning, a 173-year-old glass-making company, is playing a crucial role in the AI revolution by producing next-generation fiber optic cables that power data centers for tech giants. Under CEO Wendell Weeks, the company has seen its market cap reach $41 billion and 2023 revenue hit $13 billion, with optical fiber now contributing 30% of its revenue. Weeks' leadership and innovative approach, admired by figures like Jeff Bezos and Jony Ive, are key to Corning's success in this evolving technological landscape.

articles.title: IBM eyes first record since 2013 as AI optimism fuels 19 percent rally
articles.summary: IBM has reportedly hit its highest stock price since 2013, nearing an all-time high, driven by investor optimism in its AI and cloud investments. Despite trailing Magnificent Seven stocks in five-year returns, IBM's 19% gain this year, fueled by strong Q4 2023 results and AI demand, positions it for potential re-rating. Wall Street remains divided on its growth prospects, but its robust 3.43% dividend yield sets it apart from many big tech companies.

articles.title: Government sues Ticketmaster owner and asks court to break up company's monopoly on live events
articles.summary: The Justice Department and 30 states have filed a sweeping antitrust lawsuit against Ticketmaster and its parent company, Live Nation Entertainment, accusing them of operating an illegal monopoly over live events. The lawsuit seeks to break up the company, alleging that its practices stifle competition, harm artists, and inflate ticket prices for consumers through excessive fees. Live Nation denies the allegations, stating that the lawsuit will not address the real issues affecting ticket prices and that competition has eroded Ticketmaster's market share.

articles.title: Microsoft on the Edge: Bounce Back or Breakdown? Gear Up for Earnings Showdown
articles.summary: This article from The Xchange Newsletter discusses upcoming Q3 earnings for various technology companies, including Microsoft. It highlights the potential for volatility around these earnings reports and suggests that traders should prepare for significant market movements. The piece also references several other articles related to earnings and market trends for major companies like Apple, Micron, Alphabet, and Nvidia.

articles.title: Diversification: Definition, How It Works
articles.summary: This article defines diversification as an investment strategy that spreads investment dollars across various assets to reduce risk and enhance potential returns. It explains how diversification minimizes the impact of market volatility and asset-specific risks by blending dissimilar assets like stocks and bonds across different industries, geographies, and company sizes. The piece also discusses methods for achieving diversification, including asset allocation, mutual funds, ETFs, target-date funds, and robo-advisors.

articles.title: The 10 highest-paid CEOs
articles.summary: A new study by Equilar reveals that CEO compensation for S&P 500 companies surged by 12.6% in 2023, with median pay reaching $16.3 million, largely driven by stock awards. Broadcom's Hock Tan topped the list as the highest-paid CEO, earning over $161 million. The article details the top 10 highest-paid chief executives, including their companies, industries, and total compensation packages.

articles.title: Transact Campus Expands Across Canada with University of Victoria’s Mobile Credential Launch
articles.summary: Transact Campus has launched its Mobile Credential solution at the University of Victoria, making it the sixth major Canadian post-secondary institution to adopt this technology. This initiative aims to enhance campus experiences by providing seamless access to services via Apple and Google Wallet for students, faculty, and staff, aligning with the university's commitment to sustainability and modern student services. Transact is planning further expansion across Canada in 2025.

articles.title: Experts Think a Broadcom Stock Split Is Coming in 2025. Should You Buy AVGO Now?
articles.summary: Experts anticipate another Broadcom (AVGO) stock split in 2025 following a significant rally in 2024 driven by its AI and semiconductor performance. Broadcom's strong fundamentals, including impressive revenue and earnings growth, high free cash flow, and strategic advancements in AI and edge computing, reinforce its appeal. Analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" rating for AVGO stock, signaling confidence in its continued growth trajectory.

articles.title: Broadcom Inc. (AVGO) Poised for Strong 2025 Growth with Custom AI Chips and Strategic Partnerships, Says William Blair
articles.summary: Broadcom Inc. (AVGO) is anticipated to experience strong growth in 2025, driven by its custom AI chip development and strategic partnerships with major cloud customers, according to William Blair. The company recently surpassed a $1 trillion market cap and its CEO announced the development of custom AI chips with three large cloud clients. William Blair maintains an Outperform rating, expecting steady growth from existing partnerships and potential new clients like ByteDance, OpenAI, and Apple.

articles.title: 10 Cheat Codes I Learned While Scaling to $400M with Yext and Roam Founder Howard Lerman
articles.summary: Howard Lerman, founder of Yext and Roam, shares ten unconventional "cheat codes" that helped scale Yext to $400M. These strategies include memorizing your company's story, embracing risky live demos, rethinking traditional 1:1 meetings, and leveraging advisors over extensive outbound sales. Lerman emphasizes the importance of direct customer engagement, strategic board appointments, and prioritizing product-market fit above all else, while encouraging founders to have fun and construct their company their own way.

articles.title: |让一部分人先看到未来
articles.summary: |The article covers several significant corporate and industry news items. Liangpin Puzi plans to sue an anti-counterfeiting internet celebrity, while Shanghai authorities investigate Pechoin cosmetics for alleged banned ingredients. Google addressed death threats from its AI chatbot, and the article also highlights major developments from SpaceX, Tencent's "Black Myth: Wukong" game, and financial reports from companies like Ctrip, Kingsoft, and XPeng.

articles.title: How Boston Scientific's digital and IT boss upgraded her team from order takers to strategic thinkers
articles.summary: Jodi Eddy, Boston Scientific's SVP and chief information and digital officer, transformed her IT team from order-takers to strategic thinkers, enabling technology to address complex healthcare systems. Eddy implemented a digital leader on every executive management board and oversaw the development of a new e-commerce site. The article also discusses Boston Scientific's cautious exploration of generative AI for internal use, while highlighting its focus on supporting human decision-making rather than replacing it.

articles.title: Large-Cap Tech Stocks Could Soar Again in 2025
articles.summary: Large-cap tech stocks, particularly the Magnificent Seven, are expected to continue their dominance and strong performance in 2025, according to market observers. Despite concerns over valuations and regulation, their focus on innovation and diversification positions them for another banner year. ETFs like Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) and Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM) offer efficient exposure to these high-performing companies for growth-focused portfolios.

articles.title: Growth ETFs Shaken Up as Tech Takes on Value Blush
articles.summary: Growth ETFs like IVW are undergoing significant rebalancing as major tech companies such as Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, and Adobe are no longer considered pure growth stocks by S&P Global. This reclassification means investors will see a smaller allocation to these tech giants in growth ETFs and a larger presence of financial firms like Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Chase, which are now being given a "growth blush". The rebalancing also shifts tech's share in the S&P Value Index significantly, with these companies now having their weightings divided between growth and value characteristics based on S&P's multifactor analysis.

articles.title: EWC, Canada ETFs Rise Amid Trudeau Resignation
articles.summary: The iShares MSCI Canada ETF (EWC) rose following the announcement of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's resignation, citing a need for new leadership. The article also discusses why Canadian ETFs have historically lagged behind U.S. equity ETFs like SPY, attributing it to factors such as sector concentration, innovation, market size, currency effects, venture capital, and global influence.
